faqs.question: What is the application fee for applying to Dr BR Ambedkar School of Economics?
faqs.answer: Ans.The application fee for CUET is for various categories is as follows:General/ OBC/ EWS Applicants – INR 800SC/ST Applicants – INR 350PWD Applicants – NILFor Applications in BASE:M.Sc.: INR 300 for Gen, OBC, INR 150 for SC/ST and NIL for PWD candidatesIntegrated M. Sc. + B. Sc.: INR 200 for Gen, OBC, INR 100 for SC/ST and NIL for PWD candidatesPhD registration fee (Upon selection to PhD program)- INR 30000. The fee for the Doctoral program is INR 26000 per year (payable in two instalments of INR 13000 each) and PhD submission and Examination fee INR 30000.

faqs.question: What is the fee structure for Dr BR Ambedkar School of Economics?
faqs.answer: Ans.The fee structure is as follows:For B. Sc. – INR 60,000For M. Sc. – INR 110400 for Gen and OBC and INR 107450 for SC/ST.PhD – INR 26,000/yearIt is advised that the students go through the brochure of the university before applying.

faqs.question: What are the roles of a Dr BR Ambedkar School of Economics PhD scholar?
faqs.answer: Ans.All Doctoral candidates are required to work as a Teaching Assistant/Research Assistant under the Research Supervisor. Doctoral candidates who are not receiving any research fellowship/grant may apply for paid teaching assistance facility by following the University Guidelines.

faqs.question: Is the hostel facility available for both boys and girls at Dr BR Ambedkar School of Economics?
faqs.answer: Ans.Yes, the hostel facility is available for both boys and girls. The hostel facility is also available for PhD scholars.

faqs.question: Is there any reservation for the candidates from Karnataka a Dr BR Ambedkar School of Economics?
faqs.answer: Ans.60% seats are reserved for students of Karnataka and the remaining 40% seats are reserved for students of all States of the country including Karnataka. Of the 60% seats reserved for students of Karnataka, 20% is reserved for Scheduled Caste and 10% for Scheduled Tribe students. As regards other reservations, the policy adopted by the Government of Karnataka will be followed. Of the 40% seats reserved for students of all States of the country including Karnataka, 20% is reserved for Scheduled Caste and 10% for Scheduled Tribe students as per Government of India reservation notiﬁcation.

faqs.question: What are the scholarships available for the students applying to Dr BR Ambedkar School of Economics?
faqs.answer: TheBASE shall facilitate the scholarship applications of the reserved category and minority students by providing them with the required AISHE (All India Survey on Higher Education) Code.

Section.name: About Dr. B.R. Ambedkar School of Economics
Section.description:
Dr BR Ambedkar School of Economics was established in the year 2017. The University was inspired by the world-famous, “London School of Economics”. The University provides UG, PG courses like a B.Sc and an M.Sc in the field of Economics. It also offers PhD and integrated Courses like B.Sc+M.Sc courses. The admission is based on both merit and Central Universities Common Entrance Test. It accepts admissions based on merit. The application mode is online.
The institute offers a B.Sc, M.Sc, PhD, Diploma and certificate level courses in the field of Economics.
